page.title: 01SKEGNESS EAST COAST TOWN
page.content: Skegness is a small holiday resort on the {East Coast},mainly used by people from the Midlands.It has parks,theatres and a great many shops,but mainly it is set up for the tourists with fish and chip shops,Bingo Halls and arcades.The beach is the biggest attraction in Summer.There are also lots of sand dunes further along than the tourists beach.The Vine Hotel,on Vine Avenue is the oldest hotel in Skegness.It is said that Lord Tennyson,the 19th.Century Lincolnshire poet slept there.We have a Golf Course called Seacroft Golf Course on Drummond Road.This sport proves popular,but bowling seems to be the best liked.Along South Parade there are lots of bowling greens,this adds to the huge range of entertainments Skegness has.
